required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Uveal Melanoma and Brachytheraphy: Long-term Outcomes.
clinical_study.official_title: Long-term Outcomes in Uveal Melanoma After Ruthenium-106 Brachytherapy

brief_summary.textblock: This study investigated the visual and anatomical outcomes, tumor control, tumor recurrence, distant metastasis and cancer free survival in patients affected by uveal melanoma and undergoing Ru-106 plaque brachytherapy between February 2011 and March 2020

primary_outcome.measure: To evaluate long-term outcomes in patients underwent brachytherapy for uveal melanoma
primary_outcome.time_frame: Mean follow-up was 4 years (3 months-9 years)
primary_outcome.description: To investigate the visual and anatomical outcomes, tumor control, tumor recurrence, distant metastasis and cancer free survival

intervention.description: All patients, affected by uveal melanoma, were treated with 106 Ruthenium plaque brachytherapy to a total dose of 100 Gy to the tumor apex. The time of implant duration was calculated according to the conventional central-axis-point dose calculation

study_pop.textblock: The participans were older than 40 years with uveal melanoma and they underwent Ruthenium 106 brachytherapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age older than 40 years
- diagnosis of uveal melanoma
Exclusion Criteria:
- age older than 80 years
- No diagnosis of uveal melanoma
